name: 青少年發展
goals: Describe, compare, and contrast biological, familial, social, and diversity factors which influence adolescent development.
Apply major theories of adolescent development to practice and research.
Analyze factors that affect the well-being of contemporary adolescents.
培養終身學習及生涯發展的能力
syllabus:
1.  COURSE DESCRIPTION AND INTRODUCTION
2.  PUBERTY, HEALTH, AND BIOLOGICAL FOUNDATIONS
3.  THE BRAIN AND COGNITIVE DEVELOPMENT
4.  THE SELF, IDENTITY, EMOTION, AND PERSONALITY
5.  GENDER
6.  SEXUALITY
7.  MORAL DEVELOPMENT, VALUES, AND RELIGION
8.  MIDTERM EXAM
9.  FAMILIES
10.  PEERS, ROMANTIC RELATIONSHIPS, AND LIFESTYLES
11.  SCHOOLS
12.  ACHIEVEMENT, WORK, AND CAREERS
13.  CULTURE
14.  PROBLEMS IN ADOLESCENCE AND EMERGING ADULTHOOD 
15.  GROUP PRESENTATION
16.  FINAL EXAM
17.  FLEXIBLE LEARNING
18.  FLEXIBLE LEARNING

methodologies.note: Instructor introduces the main theories and important topics related to adolescent development.

students divide into small groups and discuss the questions assigned to them. Students need to apply the knowledge they acquired during the lecture into their discussion and present their results to the whole class.
Students work with each others during the class discussions and their group project. Through the experiences, students learn collaboration and leadership skills.
PowerPoint and videos are used to supplement the teaching and learning experiences.

grading.note: The in-class discussions may occur at any point, during any class, and may be collected at any point (beginning, middle, or end of class).
Attendance will be taken every week. Students who are consistently tardy or absent will receive 0 points in the category.
This is a group project. Each group will watch a novel or a movie about adolescence and present their review and reflection. Detailed instruction will be announced in the class.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
